title.narrative: NUTRITION GOUVERNANCE & ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, the Government has the capacity to implement, monitor and coordinate multisectoral approaches in nutrition at central, regional and communal levels., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Evaluation, Evaluation And Research, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Research, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Government has the capacity to implement, monitor and coordinate multisectoral approaches in nutrition at central,regional and communal levels.

description.narrative: The government adopted the decree raising the institutional anchorage of the multisectoral nutrition coordination body to the Presidency of Burkina Faso in July 2021. The adoption by the government in March 2021 of the marketing code for breastmilk substitutes is a step forward for the protection of breastfeeding. The nutrition information system was strengthened, including the effective integration of nutrition indicators (prevention and management) in the national health information system (DHIS2), performance reviews of routine data and national nutrition surveys, to monitor the coverage and effectiveness of specific and sensitive interventions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
